content.description: Climb the face past 3 bolts at the right end of the wall. The start is about 10' to the right of the Cornflake Crack.
content.location: Ten feet to the right of the Cornflake Crack on the inside wall of the Library.

content.description: Interesting moves -- not so murky.    If only this were longer.
content.protection: 3 bolts up to two-bolt top anchor below top of cliff.
content.location: Bolt line between Lavwelle Latte and Flamer.

climbs.name: Lavwelle Latte
climbs.fa: Bob Barrett, Rob Holzman, Nick Morell

content.description: Start to the right of Easy Day for a Layback and climb the face past 3 bolts. Decent face holds to an easy top out.
content.location: Just to the right of Good Day for a Layback.

content.description: A bit harder and with more variety than Grey Face.   Get up onto the top of the low nose (crux, awkward) - (of course without using the Grey Face holds). Then straight up to right-facing corner (which is just right of Grey Face upper bolts) with some interesting moves.   . (optional extra: Continue to top of high block to the right above the two-bolt anchor for Grey Face - ? not protected ?)
content.protection: No bolts on the route. Two-bolt anchor for Grey Face near top is to the left of this route (and below the high block at top of this), so likely needs Trad directional to get a top-rope over this route -- or a separate Trad anchor to set up top-rope protection for the optional move to the high top block.
content.location: At the round-ish "nose" about eight feet high and about three feet wide, with a nicely positioned inch-wide crack midway up its right side.   Just right of Grey Face start (which has shallow dihedral up to first bolt). Just left of the thin corner-crack which is left below the upper-half not-so-thin flake/crack of the Cornflake Crack route.

content.description: Climb over a bulge just right of the previous route and follow the left side of the face to an easy top out.
content.location: Ten feet left of the Corn Flake Crack.

climbs.name: Great Expectations
climbs.fa: R. Holzman, N. Morrel, B. D'Antonio

content.description: Climb past two bolts to the crux at the third bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts, possible gear placement after the third bolt
content.location: first bolted route to the right of flamer

content.description: Between the two trees, this spectacular face climb follows three bolts.
content.protection: Three bolts plus a two-bolt top anchor.
content.location: Between a tree and a tree-stump of similar diameter about eight feet right from the tree, below three bolts.

content.description:
Interesting moves up the right side of the arete.  

  . (Perhaps more difficult if attempt to climb directly on the arete?)
content.protection:
Top-Rope: Can set up top anchor on flat top of the detached main block, using a static line attached to trees or a chockstone.

 Or perhaps use fixed hardware -- see reports below under Comments.

 As of 2015: 3 bolt studs up to two bolt studs for top anchor just below top of cliff ... But no hangers on any of the bolt studs as of 2015.
content.location: The line of bolt studs along the right side of the arete, which is at the Left (southwest) end of the face which is the left half of the real wall of the (detached) main block. This arete forms the right edge of the entrance to an obvious wide chimney between the main block and another smaller detached block to the southeast (left) from the Main Block.

content.description: Climb the crack starting just to the right of Grey Face. This is a great beginners climb with great gear placement.
content.location: Just to the right of Grey Face.

content.description: Climb the face between Great Expectations and the arete+chimney.
content.protection: Two bolt anchor above top-out on left side of block. Can be extended with cordelette for top-rope.
content.location: To the right of Great Expectations and about five feet left of the arete (with two bolts) + chimney.

content.description:
Start up the corner/arete. Finish up the corner/arete past two bolts.   Variation (easier): Start on Brass Monkey face, then move right to the arete and bolts. 

  (One print guidebook gives the name of this route as, "5.10b")
content.protection:
Two bolts, but the first bolt is a long ways up. The landing for bouldering the starting sequence is not so good -- alternative is the Brass Monkey start on the face, then move Right to the arete. 

  Top-Rope: Setting up top anchor for Top Rope requires long slings or short static line  (perhaps also some Trad gear?)
content.location: On the arete/corner at the Right end of the wall with Flamer and Great Expectations. Left side of the chimney which is at the Left end of the Gray Face wall.

content.description:
The west side of the interior corridor of the Library -- which is the east wall of the big detached block. 

  When approaching from Paradise, the main thing you see is the large detached block. Then when you get there you discover a corridor behind the block, between the main block and a "normal" non-detached cliff face. The corridor and the two main faces of the block all run roughly SSW to NNE. The widest and easiest entrance to the corridor is on its NNE end.
